result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 4 days Huber for non-payment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Corey J Malone in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducts plea colloquy.   Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court finds defendant guilty.
State makes sentencing recommendations. Defense is in agreement. 

The Court Orders the Following:

$330.50 to be paid within 90 days (Apply cash bail). Failure to pay: will result in 4 days Huber.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
